snippet.title: Perth woman mauled to death by dog
snippet.content:
A woman from Perth's southern suburbs has been mauled to death by a dog. Sue Lopicich was walking a number of dogs at Barko's Boarding and Rescue in Southern River around 1.30pm yesterday when one of the animals turned on her. She died at the scene. When police arrived a short time later, one of the animals was so aggressive they called in rangers from the City of Gosnells. Rangers then seized a bullmastiff and a bull terrier. 9NEWS understands it was the mastiff that attacked Ms Lopicich. Ms Lopicich was a passionate animal lover who also used to work at the Animal Protection Society of Western Australia. Police aren't treating her death as suspicious and are preparing a report for the coroner.
Related Articles
City of Gosnells won't make a decision on whether to put down both or one of the dogs until the police investigation is finished. (C) Nine Digital Pty Ltd 2017
